level.text: When used in this chapter, the following terms and phrases shall have the meanings ascribed:
Approved – approved by the Minimum Wage and Industrial Safety Board.
Board – the D.C. Minimum Wage and Industrial Safety Board.
Clearance between tracks – the shortest distance between the center lines of adjacent tracks.
Height of a freight car – the distance between the top of the rail and the top of the running board.
Overhead clearance – the vertical distance from the level of the top of the highest rail to a structure or obstruction above that level.
Side clearance – the shortest distance from the center line of the track to a structure or obstruction at the side of the track.
Width of a freight car – twice the distance from the center line of the car to the extreme outside part of the car.

level.heading: SOURCE
level.text: Section 11-2604, effective September 1, 1958, ch. 26, 5 DCR 28 (August 11, 1958); 11B DCRR.
